pr_title: Fix: add the missing otf font extension.

timeline.message: Fix: add the missing otf font extension.

timeline.author: knoobie

replies.bodyText:
Is that even used ever for web ? At a quick glance it seems Microsoft specific
EDIT: answering myself to myself: as favicon
replies.author: pleku

replies.bodyText: Wasn't the vaadin favicon an .ico file in the old framework versions? I'm so used to that file ending kinda, that's why I'm asking :)
replies.author: knoobie

replies.bodyText:
Favicon is still often an ico file, but it is set as a link with the rel=icon" attaribute so it doesn't go through css.
@rolfsmeds how common would it be to use a .ico in css?
replies.author: caalador

replies.bodyText: Extremely rare. Safe to ignore I'd say..
replies.author: rolfsmeds

replies.bodyText: Sorry for the noise, ignoring is 👍 - I missed the obvious comment above the list of file endings.. 🤦‍♂️
replies.author: knoobie
